title: Apache160
author: Apache160
content: Please can someone tell me what altcoins is and how toknow Altcoins

comments.author: albert0bsd
comments.created_time: October 08, 2023, 02:41:51 PMLast edit: October 08, 2023, 03:10:24 PM by albert0bsd
comments.body: An alt-coin is any other alternative to bitcoin.According to https://www.ledger.com/academy/crypto/what-is-the-difference-between-coins-and-tokens#:~:text=%E2%80%94%20Coins%20are%20any%20cryptocurrency%20that,interesting%20properties%20relating%20to%20interoperability.Quote‚Äî Coins are any cryptocurrency that has a standalone independent blockchain (Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple‚Ä¶)‚Äî Tokens are digital assets that operate on an existing blockchain network instead of on their own. This gives them some interesting properties relating to interoperability.You should know the difference between them, also i don't recomento to invest in alt-coins or tokens.

comments.author: Sim_card
comments.body: Quote from: Apache160 on October 08, 2023, 02:37:24 PMPlease can someone tell me what altcoins is and how toknow AltcoinsOP, you should move this topic to altcoins board.Altcoins are known to be an alternative cryptocurrency to bitcoin, altcoins are duplicate of bitcoin and they all depend on bitcoin price movement in their pump and dump. We have numerous altcoins out there in the market and it is not advisable to invest in them, because their devs use them to extort money from the people after a hype. Here are some altcoins Etherum, Litecoin, Dodgecoin and many more. There is no special way of knowing altcoins, as long as it is not bitcoin, then you should know that it is altcoin.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Practice using your favorite search engine when asking super common questions to prevent unnecessary redundant threads.https://www.investopedia.com/terms/a/altcoin.asphttps://cointelegraph.com/learn/what-is-an-altcoin-a-beginners-guide-to-cryptocurrencies-beyond-bitcoinhttps://www.fool.com/terms/a/altcoin/

comments.author: albert0bsd
comments.body: Quote from: mk4 on October 08, 2023, 02:48:12 PMPractice using your favorite search engine when asking super common questions to prevent unnecessary redundant threads.I think that OP is some alternate account of somebody else, if you see the post receive merit from some other new account, that is suspicious because the post don‚Äôt deserve it.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: Apache160 on October 08, 2023, 02:37:24 PMPlease can someone tell me what altcoins is and how to know AltcoinsYou've been hunting around the Bounties (Altcoins) board for a year and a half, and it's just hilarious that you still don't know what Altcoins are.¬† But hey, since the Obong Okon account magically came to life after a long slumber just to give this post a merit, I'm starting to wonder if you know what Alt-account means.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Quote from: Apache160 on October 08, 2023, 02:37:24 PMPlease can someone tell me what altcoins is and how toknow Altcoins Altcoins are a different types of cryptocurrency which is created as an alternative to an already existing coin which is Bitcoin. There are different reasons why it is created like faster transaction confirmation compared to Bitcoin and many more. To this day, each of us have different altcoins that we prefer to use like I want to use xrp because it has low transaction fee and the transaction getting confirmed is also fast.

comments.author: promise444c5
comments.body: Op you made a mistake on the subject of your post ¬†Alt-. The simple answer to your question is Any alternate coin to BTC from ¬†the word Alt-. But left to me, I won't say they are alternate I will call the subordinates You can make use of links from the board to learn more about its differences¬† also you can use Google to check more

comments.author: goxcraft
comments.body: Any crypto currency apart from Bitcoin is considered Altcoins. Literally anything you see these days. Bitcoin is the one & only true coin. On the other hand Altcoins is also called as shitcoins. Not all of them but most of them, as far as I know. Because altcoins aren't as good as bitcoin. They may have a huge potential large liquidity. But if you look at the past, you'll see most of them became trash or lost to the ground. That is the reason behind called shitcoins. They can only give you temporary profits. Bitcoin is the only cryptocurrency that has survived this far from the very beginning.
